args: What's with the panting, Arc?\nThat's not like you.
Never mind that! I got some new info\non those rumors folks're spreadin'\nabout ya.
I have no interest in such rumors.
You might not give a damn, but I've\nbeen worried about 'em for a while.
Folks are sayin' ya been poisonin' wells\nand killin' innocent folk left and right—\nwhich ain't the Shadewolves' way, yeah?
Of course. I strictly forbade my men from\nharming civilians—and the punishments\nfor doing so were severe.
Yeah, so then why does everyone keep\nsayin' ya HAVE been doin' that?
Anyway, that's why I've been looking\ninto this whole ＂Shadewolves' leader＂\nbusiness lately.
Turns out, the rumors talk about one guy,\nbut there's actually TWO!
One's a blade-wieldin' man with scars on\nhis face, and the other is a hooded man\nwhat carries around the same kinda sword.
The one with scars sounds like Victor,\nbut this hooded man...
I think the cat what's doing all the\nterrible atrocities is the one who's\nhidin' his face with that hood.
Sounds like the two of ya have the\nsame sword, though. Any idea who\nthis guy might be?
A sword like mine... Robelle!\nDoes he truly still live?!
I take it you know this man?
I only stand alive in front of you now\nbecause of Robelle.
He and I are old friends. We were both\ndispatched here by our country, and he\nserved as my adjutant in the Shadewolves.
When we were attacked, he took my sword\nand pretended to be me so I might make\nmy escape in the confusion.
The blade I use now was originally his.\nI kept it as a memento, never once\nthinking he might still be alive.
Victor, let's go look for this hooded man.
I hate to ask your aid in this matter,\nand yet...I may have no choice.

Based on my knowledge of the imperial
army's fighting trends, I've determined
that this mountainous region would be
Robelle's most likely spot for an attack.
I see. It'd be easy to cause a rockslide,\nand with one side blocked by the cliff\nface, they'd have nowhere to run.
If Robelle really is alive, I know he\nwould come to the same conclusion.
Are these traces of a rockslide?
The imperial soldiers have fallen,\njust like Victor said.
N-no! I'm not with the Empire!\nThey only asked me to guide them!
If you would serve the Empire,\nyou share in their culpability.
I will kill every last one of them!
Hey! What kind of creep runs around\nkillin' unarmed civilians!
Stop! Robelle, it's me! It's Victor!\nIf you are Robelle, then show your face!
Yes, Commander. It's me. It's Robelle.
I can't believe you're still alive!

I was so absorbed in ensuring your
escape that I slipped and tumbled
down a cliffside. When I came to,
I was lying alone on a riverbank.
But if YOU'RE alive, then maybe\nothers survived as well!
No. They all fell to save me.
Damn... Well, we all agreed to fight to\nthe last to see that happen, so at least\nour plan was not in vain.
Where have you been all this time?\nWhat have you been doing?
Have you been fighting the Empire?\nWas this rockslide your doing?
It is as you say—I have devoted all my\nefforts to avenging our fallen.
And how, exactly, have you been taking on\nan entire army by yourself?

If you can't say it, I will. You resorted to
methods that break the code of the
Shadewolves. Your vengeance has
claimed the lives of innocent civilians.
You burned them in their beds...\nYou poisoned the water they drink...\nYou defied all that we stood for.
I had no choice! I cannot fight against\na horde of men the way you do!
If I wanted to avenge our comrades,\nI didn't have the luxury of choice\nwhen it came to method.
Besides, the Shadewolves are no more.\nThere's no point in maintaining a code\nwhen the people who wrote it are gone.
The Shadewolves' fight is not over.\nNot so long as I stand.
Then let us fight together, Commander!\nLet's both have our revenge!
No. You have forgotten the pride of the\nShadewolves. You are no longer one of us.
...Not one of them?\nI did all of this FOR them!
And shamed their names in the process.
As my former comrade, you deserve a\nwarrior's death. ...Draw your sword.
Commander... N-no... I wanted...\nmore time...with you...
Enough, old friend. Be at peace.
